Freda was so welcoming to our dog and did not make us feel like a burden at all - Hooch (dog) loved to lay out on the patio and people watch with us.  We will definitely be returning to enjoy another relaxing weekend!

Like last year, We spent three beautiful days at Freda's B&B. She is nice, generous and kind, more a friend than a host. We had a beautiful room,  with a patio for breakfast, and she provided us with umbrella and chairs for the beach, beach towels and everything we needed. She also let us store our luggage in the room after check out time so we could go to the beach without loading the car. Breakfast is more a brunch than a breakfast, everything is good and fresh. We are ready for our third year!

Initially, we were wary of staying here after arriving b/c of the size. It's more accurate to say it's a room rental rather than a bed-and-breakfast as it's advertised. However, our intentions to cut our stay short was easily accommodated, and Freda is a gem. In addition to the outstanding location (you can down a shot around the corner and be home before the sting hits), Freda is a gem. She made every effort to meet our needs, gave great (and accurate) recommendations for food and drink, and shared stories and quips in a fun and engaging way without going overboard. I simply don't have an early morning appetite, but the breakfast she whipped up gave me 2nd thoughts.   If you're not worried about space or privacy and aren't paying a premium (as we did b/c of Comic Con weekend),

My wife and I celebrated our one year wedding anniversary with a short weekend getaway to San Clemente and we had the pleasure of staying with Freda at the Always Inn.  We were surprised how comfy and cozy the rooms were with a walkout patio, refrigerator, jetted tub and flat screen T.V.  Centrally located we were able to stroll to the pier and enjoy an unexpected farmer's market and Sunday art fair.  Freda was a wonderful host virtually cooking nonstop and made us feel right at home.  She even sent us home with a bag of avocados and homemade soup!  If you're looking to stay somewhere with true personality this is the place.  We’re planning on making this an annual trip and will highly recommend to friends and family!

Summary Heading: to escape a  hot  weekend in the  valley, and  enjoy a cooler day at the  beach
Summary: This  B&B was better  than  i expected. It was very kick back. We got  her  on a  Sunday and were  able to enjoy the  farmers  market which  was just around the  corner, great  farmers market.We are looking  forward  to returning soon.  Thank you Freda hope to see ya soon in the  hear future. from David & Michelle in the valley !

This experience exceeded every expectation I had! Freda is amazing! We found a new friend in her and I look forward to going back to visit. We felt at home from the minute we arrived and were sad to leave. Freda made us amazing breakfasts and snacks that were catered to our tastes and beyond anything you would get at a typical B&B or resort. Indy, the resident dog, is friendly and well behaved and was a welcome addition to our stay. The B&B is quaint with an eclectic flair that we enjoyed as we used the different patios and common areas. There are 3 different rooms, all of which seem very adequate. Nothing over the top but very homey and comfortable, exactly what we were looking for. The location is perfect…a few blocks from the beach and right in town where you can enjoy many

Summary Heading: Quaint B&B within walking distance of the water
Summary: My wife and I made the short train ride up to San Clemente on Memorial Day weekend and really enjoyed our stay at Freida's B&B. It didn't take more than 10 minutes to walk here from the train, and we were within walking distance or all the main attractions in town. Freida was super hospitable and gave us great tips for making our way about town. The location, although very close to the main drag, was rather quiet. The room was average sized and had a shared patio, which was a nice place to sit and read. We enjoyed our weekend at the Always Inn and look forward to visiting again soon.

The Always Inn is a delightful B&B in the heart of San Clemente. Freda is a cheerful and generous hostess whose warmth and kindness are evident from the moment you walk in the door. It isn't until you sit down for breakfast that you realize that you are in for an amazing culinary experience. She easily accommodates dietary constraints (we are vegan) and whips up a new dish each morning to go with plenty of fresh fruit & pastries and great coffee. We booked at the last minute, so the room we had was lovely, but located on a main street, so there was street noise, but with ear plugs, we slept with no trouble. When we return, we will book one of the rooms away from the main street. We can't recommend Freda and this oasis highly enough!

This was our 1st time in San Clemente, and we're so glad we stayed at the Always Inn B&B.  Freda is the owner of this quaint inn, and she is so wonderful.  She was so welcoming, helpful, and went out of her way to help us with a minor "hair emergency".  Her recommendations were spot on, and her cooking is amazing.  Plus, the inn is a block away from the cutest shops and dozens of restaurants, and is across the street from a local theater where we saw a very good play.  It's also just blocks away from the beach and pier.  Everyone we talked to knew Freda and loved her, and it's easy to see why.  We can't wait to go back and can't recommend this place enough.  THANK YOU, FREDA!

My husband and I spent two nights at this wonderful B&B.  Freda, the owner, is the most welcoming and caring innkeeper we have ever met.  She introduced us to local vendors as well as offered expert advice for dinners and we were fortunate to see the play at the theater across the street.  The B&B was very warm, inviting and had all the amenities one would expect.  The breakfasts that Freda prepared far exceeded our expecations and I think we are still full from the hearty breakfasts.  Fredas care and concern for her visitors as well as her community are above reproach.  We hope to be back.

We were treated like family by Freda, the owner.  What a breakfast! Lots of local flare.  And the location is right in the heart of San Clemente.  Wonderful. Walking distance to the beach and scores of restaurants.

This bed and breakfast will steal your heart!  It's warm and cozy, the food is fabulous, and the inn keeper, Freda, is so friendly you'll feel completely relaxed and welcome.  What a great place for a home away from home!  The location was right by all the cutest shops and most wonderful restaurants and it's just minutes from the pier and the beach.  If you need to catch your breath and want to feel nurtured, this is the place to stay!  You will be treated with TLC, made to feel special, and come on... who doesn't love that?

I live in San Clemente &have heard wonderful things about Freda's little inn, but had never been inside the inn or met her. The other day I had my carpets cleaned in my house & the company used chemicals  that they weren't suppose to use. I came home to toxic fumes & had to get my pet, an raucous Amazon parrot, out of the house quickly before he became ill. I didn't want to go to some icky hotel so I called Always in a panic to see if I could bring him over for the night. I explained I had never taken him to a hotel & was afraid he would bother her or the other guests. She was so accomodating and friendly, she said to come on over and not to worry. I walked up the steps to the inn and the most incredible smell was comiing from her kitchen! She was cooking a delicous curry dinner

my son and I spended some days in august in that cute house and  we still remember the delicious breakfast we had...Freda is a perfect chef and you can't leave on the table the fresh fruit salad or the omlette so rich....the place is so comfortable and clean and you fell at home...even better....we really suggest everybody a stop here!!

Summary Heading: Charming, and a home away from home feel
Summary: My husband and I stayed here during our stay cation. We were greeted by complimentary cookies and snacks. The room was decorated in beach style which is fitting since it was in a beach town after all! It was walking distance to any type of restaurant you could ask for, a cute playhouse across the way and walking distance to the beach. We woke up (after sleeping in) to the aroma of a home cooked meal. We sat out on the patio and were served the most delicious breakfast and coffee/tea. We were treated like guest in someone's home. Freda was so interesting and shared with us her many talents and gave us a tour of her garden on the property and gave us a brief lesson in gardening since she is a master gardener! If we ever need a stay cation again we will definitely stay with Alway

Thanks, Freda, for a wonderful weekend at the Inn.  I think the warm chocolate cookies sold me from the first moment!  The location in the center of town with the beach footsteps away is ideal. The inn is charming and the food is good.    Linda and Cam

Summary Heading: A place where you feel nearly home!
Summary: I spent 2 nights there in July and just loved everything: the house with its charming artist taste, cosy atmosphere, family spirit, friendly patio/garden, central location vs the center of San Clemente and the sea side. Thanks to Freda and S... (cannot remember her name sorry) for their warm and friendly welcome. If you are lucky enough, you will have a bit of taste of Freda's cuisine. This is the bonus! Aline Juillerat (from Switzerland)

This was our first B&B experience. What a wonderful way to start. The Inn is cozy and charming. the Inn Keeper, Freda is Chaming and amazing as well. No need was left unserved. The rooms are quaint and very comfortable. Ours had a side patio that was very enjoyable. There is street side patio and front patio as well. Breakfasts were over the top amazing. All prepared by Freda from scratch with all local fresh ingredients that she pick up from the farmers market every Sunday. She uses all of her own spices in her cooking and the flavor is amazing. We had her prepare our anniverary dinner which she prepared to order just for us. She loves to cook and it definately shows. The location of the in is well situated and is close to the main shopping area of San Clemente and and a

My husband and I just returned from a short stay here for our second wedding anniversary and we absolutely loved it!  Quiet, comfortable and Jody was awesome.  We were the only guests during our stay (this B&B has only three rooms) and we really felt like we had a private retreat in what can be a rather busy beach town.  The beach is a short walk away, and there are restaurants literally right out the front door.  The breakfast was fabulous and a great start both days.  We loved the little patio outside the sliding rear door to our room and the bed was super comfy.  We will definitely be back, and we'll be bringing friends with us!  Thank you Always Inn!

We stayed for four nights with our little daughter (3 years old) and Freda made every effort to make us feel comfortable . She also bought some toys for the beach for our daughter! The breakfast is fantastic and you can reach the beach just walking 10 minutes  from the house

What a wonderful, relaxing and special weekend we had at Always Inn!  Freda welcomed us with open arms and treated us like long time friends.  Her hospitality, personality and expertise in the kitchen allowed for the perfect romantic getaway that we had hoped for.   Our room was immaculate, with a Q size bed, couch, large bathroom with marble shower and spa bath.  We had our own patio, quaintly decorated with lush California flowers/plants...Freda helped set up a romantic dinner for 2 on our private patio!  Always Inn is in a great location, just a few blocks away from the beach, shops, cafes and the Pier.  Always Inn will be our "home away from home" every time we visit San Clemente...Always!

Summary Heading: Always Inn- get unchained from the chains.
Summary: A quiet garden spot in walking distance of a variety shops and coffee houses and excellent restaurants.  If you want an atmosphere of being treated better than family by a great hostess who may become your great friend, this is the place.    I enjoyed the invigorating early morning walk passed the shops to the pier to watch the fishermen try their luck at Sea Bass and Corvina.  I found great souvenirs to bring home in memory of a most wonderful time.  One could explore that area for weeks and not run out of fun things to do.  As Arnold says, "I'll be back".

We were looking for a reasonably-priced quick getaway and came across this gem. Cozy. Relaxing, almost makes you feel like you're in Mexico. Freda welcomes you with open arms and makes you feel like you've been her BFF for a long time. She can surprise you with lovely treats such as chocolate-covered strawberries. Her cooking is seasoned with love because that is what she finds joy in, cooking. We were able to sleep in past 8am which NEVER happens back at home (early AM people).  Perfect place to be in the "koolaid" of San Clemente. Endless strip of boutiques and restaurants. Even though beach is three blocks away, we took a stroll and had a few drinks on the way. Loveliest stroll ever. The walk back can be a hike, but that's the best part to work up the sillies and a good

Summary Heading: cozy spot in a cozy place (and I still dream about the breakfasts we got!)
Summary: We stayed at Always Inn for two nights July 2011 after one week in San Diego and one week in Las Vegas. It was just perfect to end our holiday in San Clemente, a quiet town by the beach.  Always Inn was a nice house some 12 minutes from the beach and so to speak at the centre of the  town. Our room was little but nicely decorated and with a fridge. The bed was really soft but I slept nicely anyways. It was clean though a bit worn, which only gave it more soul in my opinion.   What really made our stay excellent was the over the top breakfasts. Man, they were fantastic. Our host was a really nice woman that did her best to make us enjoy the mornings. I did not quite get who owned the place, but nevermind, there was always someone around :)  Our host gave us some good advice on

Summary Heading: Nothing terrible, but not our favorite.
Summary: We recently had a one night stay at the Always Inn.  Nothing in their ad was misleading, but it just wasn't quite what we expected.  As previous reviewers have noted, this is a basic ranch home that has been converted to at B&B by renting out the bedrooms.  Therefore, the rooms are on the small side and quite frankly, ours was somewhat dated looking -especially the carpeting. There is a private bath for each room.  Our host, Ron, was perfectly pleasant, non-intrusive and gave us a complete welcome and thorough information.  He also prepared a delicious breakfast in the morning.  The location is great if you want to walk to town, which we did.  It's a little more of a hike to the beach, but not too bad.  Two things I would mention - when we arrived in the late afternoon, it was

I recently stayed for 2 nights at the Always Inn Bed and Breakfast. I could not have asked for a better location- less than a block from the main street with all the cute shops and restaurants, and just a few blocks from the beautiful beach. The room was comfortable and the breakfasts were incredible! The owner and inn keepers made me feel extremely welcome and made sure I had everything I needed. They even thought of little extras like sunscreen and beach chairs. I highly recommend this B and B!

Summary Heading: A great place to relax and refresh
Summary: My teenage daughter and I spent two nights at this lovely B & B.  Alma welcomed us with wonderful homemade gingerbread cookies and showed great warmth in her hospitality.  The room was very clean, nicely decorated, and a reasonable size.   Freda, the owner, came a little later and took over for the next couple of days so Alma could have a break, and she was also extremely hospitable and served up wonderful breakfasts during our two day stay.  The B & B is just around the corner from the main street where all the shops and restaurants are, and within walking distance of the beach as well.  I would highly recommend this as a wonderful place for a quiet getaway for a few days.

The Always Inn Bed and Breakfast inn was booked so we made a reservation at their Vacation Rental property. The two bedroom unit was booked, so we took the single unit. There were three of us. A mother, her 17 year old daughter and daughter's friend.   The unit was nice, clean and the neighborhood it was located in was lovely.    We found the unit be too small for three people to comfortably sleep in. There is a queen size bed and a pull out sofa. Once the sofa is opened up, there is no walking space. I would recommend this facility for no more than 2 people.  The hosts Alma and Carmelo were wonderful. They picked us up when we arrived and brought us back to the train station at the end of our trip. The were so friendly and helpful with information about the town. As we were

my daughter and I spent 7 nights in this beautiful little b&b; small enough to be intimate with the other guests, but very professionally run.   the food was deliciously healthful.  Fresh fruit, freshly prepared breakfasts, and home-made treats to snack on, as well. the innkeeper was gracious and friendly.  she met every one of our requests quickly and efficiently.  we both felt right at home from the moment we walked through the door.   the decor was cozy and homey, with artwork in abundance. every aspect of the room, bathroom, dining room and outdoor tables were spotless. i can't think of one thing they could have done to improve their little inn. and the five minute walk to the beach was pretty awesome, too!

Alma is the best!!! She is a wonderful cook too!!! This place is exactly what the doctor ordered!!! Even though it wasn't too far from home, it felt like we hundreds of miles away. The town is beautiful and the location is perfect! Close to EVERYTHING!!!  Chris and Kate

What a surprise--a bed and breakfast with 5 star award winning food, an open door for our dog, and a host that went out of her way to make us at home, with a personalized birthday card and chocolate dipped strawberries for my special 60th birthday! Freda watched our dog while we spent the day on the beach, and we were able to take chairs, umbrella, and boogie board with us at no charge. On Sunday we wer informed of special deals at the street fair on produce, plants and herbs--in fact, Freda went with me to pick out some "deals" and I came home with an armload of beautiful orchid plants and herbs. As a master gardener, she repotted plants for me and gave me invaluable guidelines to care of my new plants. My husband (usually dying to get home) did not want to leave. Freda also

We stayed here for our Anniversary weekend. We stayed 2 nights and paid $438. It was not worth it. The room was very tiny as well as the bathroom. The bed was not as nice as my bed at home. The 4 block walk to the beach wasn't bad. But the flight of stairs you have to walk to get to the beach will kill you if you have bad knees. Dale and Cindy were pleasant hosts though. They informed us on our last day that it was also their last day to host this B&B.

Summary Heading: A Lovely Inn in All Ways
Summary: Freda's Inn is a dreamy getaway in the heart of a "Spanish Village by the Sea". Traveling alone, I seek out a safe and peaceful environment and the Always Inn more than satisfied those needs. Parking was right outside the private patio entrance to my room. I enjoyed a private bath and an in-room refrigerator. The Inn is a block from the main street which provides cafes, restaurants, and every shop imaginable. The beach and pier are within walking distance and the hills just east of the Inn are filled with hiking trails. Freda gives new meaning to the art of hospitality. She likes to present an informal style which makes you feel like a member of her family. Pampering her guests doesn't even begin to describe her generosity and the amenities she offers. And, of course, the pies

Summary Heading: Incredible find in a beautiful little town
Summary: My boyfriend and I wanted an overnight trip and we chose San Clemente. Not sure where to stay, we looked on trip advisor and Always Inn was ranked as the number one B&B...now I know why! From the moment we arrived we were welcomed with open arms and the hosts were lovely and gracious people. The house is adorable and surrounded by palm trees and foliage; it is gorgeous! The front living area has seating with a fireplace and there are movies and books to borrow as well which is a nice touch. There was also fresh fruit, chocolates, tea, water and just about every other little detail a vacationer could need right down to a little travel sewing kit. The room was cozy, comfortable and quiet. The location is great as well! Just a short and pretty walk down to the pier and nearby

Summary Heading: Excellent Bed and Breakfast!  My wife and I want to come back!
Summary: The Always Inn B&B was a great place to spend my wife and my mini-honeymoon!  Our room was cozy and comfortable!  We're not big on fancy hotels, so this was right up our alley!  Felt like a home away from home.  Quiet and nice and down to earth.  Cyndalina the innkeeper was warm and friendly and cooked a great breakfast!  She'll accommodate whatever dietary needs you have!  We didn't want to leave!  We also got the added bonus of having the owner take care of us too and her cooking is also outstanding!  Definitely check it out if you're looking for a nice romantic stay!

My husband surprised me with a 1-night getaway at the Always Inn B&B in San Clemente.  We were greeted at the door by Freda (the owner) and her dog Indy 500.  She showed us our quaint little room just off the main living room.  Although the room wasn't big, it was very charming.  My husband asked Freda to make a coconut gift basket for me and also had her get me a bouquet of my favorite flowers.  Freda went out of her way to make a great gift basket with all kinds of neat goodies and she ordered me the most beautiful Star Gazer Lily bouquet I have ever seen.    The Inn is just steps from the main shopping fares which my husband and I were able to check out.  Great little town (never been to it even though we live only 15 minutes away).  Freda made us a candlelight dinner

Stellar location.  Welcoming hosts.  Great shower.  Fantastic breakfast.  We loved the mints and taffy out for the guests, and Cindelina even sent us home with some bath salts after my boyfriend said how much he enjoyed them!  The only negative is the thin walls!

My sister was in town, and we needed to get out of LA for the weekend. We wanted to go south toward San DIego...we found this great little B&B in San Clemente called the Always Inn. The rooms were fantastic, and the food was amazing! Best of all was the service! It's run by a husband and wife team, Dale & Cindalina...they were amazing! They really made it feel like you were staying at your favorite aunt & uncle's:) And better yet, it's within walking distance of EVERYTHING! We didn't get into our car until it was time to leave. San Clemente is Southern California's best kept little secret! Great restaurants, fun bars, day spas, fantastic little boutiques, and of course the beach! I can't wait to go back! Next time I'm taking my daughter who's 3...The Always Inn is also kid

Summary Heading: Wonderful  Place to stay! So much nicer than a hotel!
Summary: I really enjoyed my stay. Everyone made me feel right at home. The breakfast was also great. I look forward to staying next time I visit San Clemente. The beds were very comfortable. I would like to see them get  fluffier pillows.

Dale & Cindalina were the perfect innkeepers.  We felt right at home right away like staying at a friends home than a B&B.  Cindalina is a great cook and all of our breakfasts were yummy with fresh fruit.  There were snacks, fresh fruit and tea which you could help yourself at anytime.  We were in San Clemente to visit our son in Camp Pendleton and the Basilone Gate was only 5 minutes away.  San Clemente is way cool.  Our morning walk to the Pier, the Sunday Farmers Market on Del Mar, Billy's Meats a fabulous deli and Carbonaras Trattoria an affordable fine dining restaurant. We loved Always Inn and San Clemente and will definitely be back !!
We had a most enjoyable three days in this lovely part of California with the most hospitable hostess ever.

Summary Heading: Nice B&B in Downtown San Clemente
Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Always Inn in San Clemente for a night out (away from the kids).  The Always Inn is within a block of central San Clemente, close walking distance to restaurants and stores, and about 4 blocks from the beach (no beach view).  The hosts are very nice and friendly, made a nice hot breakfast, and are helpful with ideas.  The property itself is a house, with no view, and relatively small rooms.

My wife and I stayed here for the weekend for a friend's wedding and we couldn't have been more pleased with our stay. Steps away from the heart of the city with all the restaurants, bars and clubs. Also just a gorgeous downhill half-mile walk to the beach that of course makes San Clemente the greatest spot for a vacation.   The ocean breeze room was cute, quaint and clean. Queen sized bed was comfy cozy and the bathroom was top notch.   The host and hostess made us delicious feasts (omlettes and French toast) and made our stay very comfortable.   I can't wait to stay again when I'm back in San Clemente!

Summary Heading: You Must Stay at Always Inn
Summary: Thank you for making me look smart. I booked a room at Always Inn San Clemente for an annual family get-together and we so enjoyed the inn and innkeepers that we think we'll do the same again and again. What did we like? Cindalina's and Dale's kind welcome and all the little touches they add to an already super building with private patios and fascinating de'cor. There are breakfasts to convert any coffee-only late riser, local expertise and sight-seeing suggestions -- and that fireplace. Everything managed to work together to feel both homey and luxurious (my home should take lessons).

Summary Heading: A calm, beautify resort just off the main street
Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Always Inn over a 3-day weekend.  We had a great time.  Dale and Cindalina were very nice and took care of our every need.  The breakfasts were delicious, and we especially like how close we were to everything.  It was relaxing to watch a DVD in our room from the Inn's library after a wonderful meal just down the street.  We hope to be back again with our new family addition when she's old enough to travel.

We enjoyed our stay as the inn keepers were excellent and took such good care of us and our two Golden Retrievers. We have spent the last couple of xmas with Always Inn. We love the place and the town. My husband's sister and her husband come and stay as well.  Last year 2009 our son and his kids stayed too.  This year it was just the four of us and our dogs. We had a great time and were treated royally by the innkeepers (Cindaline and Dale). Can not give this place enough STARS!!!              Judi Ingalls

Summary Heading: A very cozy and relaxing B&B.
Summary: My wife and I just got back from our third trip to the Always Inn.  There's just something very relaxing about it that keeps us going back.  Cindalina and Dale are great hosts and the breakfast is top notch.  Downtown San Clemente is right up the street and Cabrillo Playhouse is just across the street.  Don't miss the opportunity to take in a play during your stay.

The Always Inn is located in the heart of Downtown San Clemente, within walking distance to restaurants, shopping, art galleries, day spas, the beach and the San Clemente Pier.  The Inn Keepers worked diligently to provide a comfortable environment and served a delicious cooked to order breakfast each morning.  Water, coffee, tea and snacks are available throughout the stay at no additional cost.  There are three guest rooms, each with its own attached bathroom.  The Inn is pet friendly, however; this may be somewhat of a nuisance for those of us that travel without pets.   There is a free parking space allotted for each of the guests, and an enclosed patio where bicycles and beach equipment maybe stored during the visit.

Summary Heading: The perfect way to end our week!
Summary: We loved our time at the Always Inn and wish we could have stayed longer. Right from your first step into the cozy B&B you feel like your right at home... with the added bonus of CIndalina spoiling you rotten (our dog was spoilled too!). Her cookies are divine! Looking forward to our next trip to San clemente!

Summary Heading: This review is SO overdue, but am glad...
Summary: This review is SO overdue, but am glad that I stumbled upon this site which reminded me in my hectic every day life to write this! I tell everyone I can about this place. A friend of mine travels to San Clemente on business about twice a year and in telling him last year that my husband and I were boggled trying to find somewhere different to go for our honeymoon, he mentioned San Clemente. Upon lots of research, we were dead set on the place. Next question was: where to stay? Always Inn had the best reviews and looked so charming, so we opted to stay there. Little did we know it would be heaven on earth for us and we did not want to leave. We arrived to a cute little note on the front door that was a heart cut out of paper that said our names and that Cindalina was out and

This was a great value. It is located next to the main shopping street in San Clemente.  Walked to the beach and pier both evening and morning.  Had a delicious lunch at the Mexican restaurant across the street.  The staff was very friendly and cooked up the best breakfast.   The average rating on location is because the house backs up to an alley and parking lot.   It was a little noisy in the morning when the street sweeper and trash truck came through. Still that was a minor inconvenience to us and we would gladly stay there again.

This was a great place to hold our Family Reunion vacation! Shops, restaurants, beach and pier all within walking. Take advantage of fishing at Dana Wharf. The Inn keepers - Cindalina and Dale were wonderful.

Summary Heading: Fantastic innkeepers and great location, but fix the water situation!
Summary: Cindalina and Dale were fantastic accommodating hosts and the breakfast was quite wonderful, but my wife and I both found ourselves awake at 6:30am due to the loud sound of water rushing through the walls.  That's the last thing we want on a relaxing vacation when sleeping in doesn't happen too much anymore with a baby.  The rooms are pretty small and perhaps lack a little elegance you might find in nicer BandB's.  However, for a lower-priced BnB, the Always Inn is a great option.

This was the first time my husband & I stayed at a BnB, it was quaint & very comfortable.  We were celebrating our 10 year anniversary  alongw/our furbaby-woof woof who was welcomed w/treats.    Dale & Cindalina were great innkeepers, breakfast was a delight, I suggest her banana french toast~yummy ;0)  The inn was charming & we felt at home.  I suggest enjoying a bottle of wine in front of the fireplace.  The bath products were luxurious, ladies I highly recommend the jet bath-the only downside is the bath is not big enough for two~but you feel like you are at a spa.  The inn is located in the heart of San Clemente & everything is in walking distance. We loved that our furbaby was allowed in the shops & there are two restaurants arcross the street w/outdoor dining so she could

My wife and I pleasantly stumbled upon the inn on our way to Santa Barbara.  We loved its location (within walking distance to downtown San Clemente and the beach.  We also liked the innkeepers who were very friendly, knowledgeable, and good cooks!  The only minus was that the rooms were a bit small (for the price).  Perhaps the owners could remove some pieces of furniture so that there would be a little more room.  I would definitely recommend this place to others.

My husband and I were very surprised and pleased by the hominess and quaintness of this San Clemente B and B.  As soon as we walked in, we felt right at home.  This B and B isn't a large place, but very small and intimate.  The decor was interesting, the Innkeepers were marvelous and very hospitable, and the rooms were very clean.  I especially loved having breakfast made for us every morning.  Cindalina is a great cook.  The bedrooms aren't  large, but they are comfortable and each one has it's own bathroom.  I especially enjoyed the spa bathtub.  The Always Inn is located one street over from the main downtown area and about a 1/2 mile or so from the beach, which is within walking distance if you don't mind trekking up hill all the way coming back.  I have to confess I wasn't

We really enjoyed staying at the Always Inn B&B. The accomodations and location were just what we were looking for, so easy to take a walk downtown or go elsewhere. The friendliness, service, flexibility and food were well beyond expecations.

My partner and I stayed at the Always Inn in San Clemente for one night, wish we could have stayed longer.  We never did get to meet our hosts, we had a busy surf schedule, but the inn was super clean and cozy!  They even put together a continental breakfast for us to take to the beach!  Being one block away from downtown San Clemente was fabulous, we walked everywhere we needed to be!

Summary Heading: Excellent B&B, Excellent Service, Excellent Location, Excellent!!!
Summary: My wife and I took a weekend trip to San Clemente as we have been to this beautiful city in the past.  While looking for a place to stay, I stumbled upon this gorgeous bed and breakfast inn 1 block from Downtown San Clemente.  Not only was I surprised by the location of this beautiful inn, but the price was extremely reasonable, especially considering its prime location.  Try to find a Holiday Inn, Hampton Inn, etc near this location for even close to the price the innkeepers offer.  Even better, the breakfast was INCREDIBLE!!!!  No crowded buffet with no seating here.  Gourmet style, home cooked breakfast served on the patio in wonderful 75 degree, sunny weather.         What I would like to mention is the extreme attentiveness of the innkeepers, Cyndalina and Dale.  The

Summary Heading: What a great place to go to
Summary: It was our 32nd Anniversary and we wanted to try something different.  It was really more than we could imagine. Great walking places, beaches, Restaurants. We loved it.
All was truly wonderful, from the delightful inn keepers to the scrumptious breakfasts to the great location to the charm of the inn...we will return and recommend.

Actually this was a business trip that we extended for pleasure.  Perfect time of year for San Clemente, cool breezes off the ocean and sparkling sunshine. Always Inn's highlight is it's innkeepers, Cindalina and Dale. Cindalina is an wonderful breakfast chef. We enjoyed visiting with them. The Inn itself is quant and in a perfect location.  If you want to see the water from your room, this will not work for you.  However, the pier and beach are a short walk away.  The Inn is less than a half block from Avenida Del Mar with wonderful shopping and dining. I would recommend spending time at Always Inn and San Clemente. On a side note, I've not stayed at many B&B's, and had to adjust to a smaller room, with a home like atmosphere, which is one of the great charms of the place.

Always Inn is a cute B&B in an EXCELLENT location, right off of San Clemente's main strip and close to the beach.  It's small, so service is great.  Dale and Cindalina were very welcoming and served a great breakfast.  The only downside is that the bedrooms are just off the living room, so there's a bit of noise.  On the plus side, they're dog-friendly.  I'd go back.

my mom booked this hotel for my graduation gift. my friend and i stayed here for a a week because it was close to the surf camp we attended.  the owner was awesome. she made us breakfast everyday..ummmm more like a feast.  her dog is lovable. owner is so kind and happy and wonderful. we loved our room and the area. its a must for all to stay here.

Our return to this B&B was just as delightful as my first visit. Delicious breakfast and so sweet to get up and have it ready for us at 5:00 am when we were going to greet our Marine coming home from deployment! Great locaton for the beach and the base!

Summary Heading: What a Gem!  Love this place!
Summary: My wife and I stayed here for a short weekend getaway from LA and absolutely loved it!  The innkeepers are truly wonderful, special people. Very kind, warm, and caring.  The place is small but has great garden/patio areas, feels very secluded and quiet.  Breakfast was outstanding!  The location is great - just 1 block from the main street with restaurants, shops, bars, etc.  Only about a 10 minute walk to the beach as well.  Definitely happy and will go back again!.
My husband and I live locally and needed to get away for a few days.  It was perfect!  Very clean and comfortable.  The Inn keepers were very nice and the breakfast was amazing.  Great location!

Summary Heading: First Experience Staying at a B&B, Great Place to Start!
Summary: We really enjoyed this B&B. A cozy, warm place to relax and enjoy the ammenities. It's in close walking distance to many unique shops, restaurants and a few blocks from the beach.

Summary Heading: 3 rd Visit - Nice even in the Rain
Summary: My wife and I stayed one night this weekend.   It was raining, but still found things to do.   Inn Keepers were nice - Breakfast was wonderful.     Would very much recommend.

Always Inn is tucked behind a beautiful garden, just a block from the "main drag" in San Clemente and a short walk to the ocean and the San Clemente pier.  The innkeepers - Cindalinda and Dale were so welcoming and warm and would do anything to make our stay more comfortable.  Fresh baked lemon cake and cookies were waiting for us, and we were shown how to turn on the charming gas fireplace.  Breakfast was served outside on the small patio and was delicious!  With just three guest rooms, this is a cozy, sweet bed and breakfast.  The rooms were small, but comfortable.   My only warning is that the walls are not soundproof and you could hear conversations coming from the hallway.  We would certainly stay there again if we are in the area.

I was surprised by the rave reviews as this wasn't our experience. We have stayed in B&Bs all over the world and this was not that great. Our room was small and cramped with every surface covered in stuff. We had no place  to unpack and put our things. The very small armoire had one shelf with a large full basket on it and only 2 hangers. No dresser. The one shelf in the bath was also covered with toiletries. The location was good but parking was limited. The hosts were friendly and the food was good. The price seemed high for what you get.

The Always Inn B&B  in San Clemente was recommended by a friend who lived in the San Clemente area. She has recommended it to others and has never had any negative feed-back.  My husband and I also had a wonderful experience. The location is great! - right in the middle of the tourtist area and within walking distance tothe beach and pier. Yet, with all the greenery around the Inn, one feels secluded and  "tucked away" from the crowds. The Inn itself, is charming and very comfortable. It is well decorated and has large friendly spaces. The living room, with it's sofa and chairs makes a inviting area in which to visit with other guests.   Our bed room w/private bath, was spacious and met all of our needs. We had a window  over looking a shaded patio and a large sliding glass door

I would highly recommend this quaint, historical colorful bed and breakfast for anyone visiting San Clemente California. The Inn Keepers Cindalina and Dale went above and beyond to make our stay a memory to be treasured. Since I grew up in San Clemente I can attest to the primo location of the Always Inn. You are steps to the heart of the city on Del Mar boasting shops, galleries and eateries for your enjoyment. Our family can't wait to return.The food, hospitality, comfort and location provide  a perfect carefree get away.Don't miss Casa Romantica it is well worth the $5.00 admission.

Summary Heading: Excellent little slice of San Clemente nicely placed with a warm feel.
Summary: Great place to spend a night or a week, for either enjoying the downtown dining or heading to the beach.

Summary Heading: The staff at Always Inn made our Christmas wonderful
Summary: This was our second Christmas at Always Inn in San Clemente Ca.  The staff was the best we have ever had.  They were there to make our Christmas a wonderful experience.   They went over and beyond what was expected.  Alice & Tony Danese

Summary Heading: Treated like royalty, made entirely comfortable
Summary: We arrived in a rainstorm. Cindalina ferried us from the train station to the house and then offered us homemade cookies as we warmed ourselves in front of the fire. The room had a jacuzzi tub and had thoughtful amenities - ironing board and iron, cold water, fridge, bathrobes, beachtowels, and all sorts of bath goodies. The room was full of original art and had a sliding door to the patio. The breakfast was delicious both days and the coffee divine. There are at least four restaurants just steps out the door for lunch and dinner. We will stay again.

We stayed for the Christmas 2009 weekend. Our party included 6 adults, a 6 year old, a 15 year old and two Golden Retrievers. We all had a great time.  The service was excellent right down to watching and walking the dogs which allowed us to go to dinner.  The breakfast was amazing right down to the details of accommodating my Gluten allergy.  We stayed xmas of 2008 and plan to stay again xmas of 2010.  Can not say enough.  Dale and Cindaline were most gracious and accommodating.   I feel we now have two new friends and a  new place to call home.

Summary Heading: Great B & B, Great Staff, Nice breakfast on lovely outdoor terrace.
Summary: Good location, just off main street in San Clemente. Reasonably priced, clean. Many amenities for guests.

Summary Heading: Quaint, friendly B&B in a great location
Summary: We had a great stay.  The B&B's location is fantastic...walking distance to the ocean and situated about mid-way between LA and San Diego.  We were very pleased that the B&B was flexible with breakfast hours and we thoroughly enjoyed the generously portioned breakfast we were served.  The "extras" on-site were really appreciated as well, i.e., DVDs, honour bar.  Very cute town loaded with friendly people, including our gracious hosts C&D.

Summary Heading: The Always Inn is a hidden treasure located in the heart of San Clemente!
Summary: From the moment I walked up to this little B & B in San Clemente I knew that I was going to love it.  The house was beautifully decorated and the gardens were amazing.  They had decorated the living room area for the holidays and there were home made cookies waiting for us by a great big fireplace.  Our room was excellent, the artwork and bedding were items I might have picked out for my own home. The private bath had a spa tub that was out of this world and the bed was super comfortable.  My significant other had been working two months straight at the San Onofre Power Plant and had been staying in the camp there on site.  This was the perfect place for him to unwind and relax instead of staying in some cold dark motel room.   We awoke in the morning to the smell of bacon and

Like staying in your own home without any of the chores. Very relaxing. Lots of effort going into making special breakfasts. Library of books and DVDs available for use. Home made snacks also available all day as well.

Summary Heading: Relaxing and Romantic in San Clemente, Perfect Location
Summary: My husband and I went to the Always inn for our 1 year anniversary! The innkeepers and the owners were sooo sweet! The Breakfast was delicious, it was different every morning.........Don't forget to tip your innkeepers for great service!  I recommend the Sea Mist room for the backdoor parking! Thank you Always Inn for a wonderful time!

Summary Heading: WE WILL NEVER FORGET OUR 12TH YR. ANNIVERSARY
Summary: We were looking for the perfect place to spend our anniversary. I came upon the Always Inn online & tthought this looks like it. From the time we arrived Dale & Cindy made our stay the most unforgettable experience we have ever had. They called ahead of time to ask for any special request which they had waiting. They baked us homemade cookies, told us of the sights to see, took our orders for breakfast (which was incredible) then left us alone to spend our anniversary. We will definitely be going back again & again & recommend it to all of our friends..

Summary Heading: Great find in the heart of downtown San Clemente!
Summary: This was a great place to stay and enjoy the town of San Clemente. We lived in San Clemente years ago and had not been back for a visit in almost 15 years. Not the small beach town it once was but…..it was grown with class. Always Inn is right in downtown and your hosts Craig and Sonia will help with lots of information on the great restaurants within walking distance from the inn. And, the great beaches of San Clemente are still there to enjoy!

Summary Heading: The Little Bed and Breakfast Paradise
Summary: I surprised my wife with a night away at Always Inn for our 11th Anniversary.  Charming, Well decorated, beautiful gardens & patios, great atmosphere, clean, cozy, romantic, great food, near great dining & beach.  She was so excited and loved it, as did I.  Although we live in OC it was like we were far away from home, kids, worries, etc.  The Inn Keepers, Craig and Sonya, were very hospitable and helpful with telling us all sorts of things to do there in San Clemente.  We only stayed one night but felt like alot more.  My wife loved the jacuzzi tub too.  The breakfast was rock'n in the morning.

We recently stayed several days in San Clemente for our son's wedding, so brought the family, including our 2 grandsons, ages 17 months and 2 months, and my mother, age 94. We took all 3 rooms and it worked out perfectly. It was as though we had a home away from home. We can't say enough about Craig and Sonia, and how they made us feel at home. The breakfast every day was excellent, wonderful coffee and other surprises. We had people coming and going during the day and evening and the patio was perfect to entertain and relax. The property is definately very good for a bed and breakfast, but the Innkeepers make it wonderful. Needless to say, with our group it was difficult to keep everything in its place all the time. Craig and Sonia still were able to keep things clean and

Always Inn and the quaint town on San Clemente made for a perfect summer weekend.  The inn is centrally located so once we parked our rental car in our designated spot, we did not have to get back in the car the entire weekend.  Terrific restaurants are across the street, around the block, and everywhere you turn. Mexican, Thai, Bistros, Wine Bars, Sea Food....Its just a matter of choosing. The beautiful beaches of San Clemente are about a half mile away and the walk is pleasant - through downtown and by neighborhood parks.  On Sunday, we strolled through the Farmer's Market and bought some lovely peaches to snack on.  Sonja and Craig provide chairs, beach towels, and umbrellas so you can comfortably enjoy the whole day at the beach.  The water is warm, blue, and perfect for

Summary Heading: Truly a home away from home!
Summary: I had a lovely stay here in late June for 2 nights while in Orange County for a conference. It is a very cozy little place and it felt like coming “home” every evening. I stayed in Ocean Dance room which has more than enough room for 2. It was also the only room without an adjoining patio but the Inn has 2 other patios where you could still have breakfast/tea outdoor. The room was very well-kept, with little extras which I thought was very thoughtful of the Innkeepers such a sleep light in the bathroom, a sleep sound machine by the bed and extra toiletries (lipbalm, sun lotion). There's free wi-fi and the location was superb. Would love to come back someday.

Summary Heading: A great retreat place for locals or out of towners.
Summary: Charming from the first look, rooms are amazing, Greg and Sonia the Inn keepers are friendly and full of great hospitality, she cooks amazing. My husband and I are locals and staying here felt like we were far away in paradise. We will retreat here as much as possible.
Nice house re-converted into a B&B. Great service, clean and centrally located in San Clemente, 5 min from the pier, next to great restaurants....

We have stayed twice at the Always Inn and have had a great experince on both occasions.  It is convenient to the downtown area/ restaurants, decorated well, clean, and the host and hostess were very friendly and accomodating.  We also enjoyed being able to take our dog with us.  Rooms are small, but it offers a cozy homelike experience.

Summary Heading: The most romantic getaway if you only have two days.
Summary: Always Inn is set in the perfect location.  You are within walking distance of shopping, food and best of all the beach.  During our stay, we enjoyed the recommendations of the Inn Keepers.  Trust me, they know what they are talking about.  Breakfast was wonderful as you get to enjoy it outside while the town is still waking up.  Always Inn is very beautiful and has a lot to offer.  This was our first time doing a B&B and it will not be our last.  We will come back and stay again at Always Inn.  The only thing I would say to watch out for is if you park in their driveway.  Make sure you pull all the way forward, my boyfriend let the back of my truck hang out in the sidewalk and we got a ticket.  LOL.  Overall, very relaxing but plenty to do.  You won't regret it.

Summary Heading: Don't miss this place, it is sensational!!!
Summary: Stayed here for 2 nights at Christmas. They are dog friendly so we (hesitantly) brought our two Golden Retrievers with us. We went to dinner and the Innkeepers offered to sit wih our dogs. When we returned several hours later, the dogs ignored us! Craig and Sonia, the innkeepers took them out for a walk and played with them until we got back. At the end of our stay, none of us wanted to leave. We all fell in love with the Inn and the Innkeepers.  It is right in the middle of downtown San Clemente,with wonderful stores to shop, The rooms are spacious and clean and they serve the most fantastic breakfast I have ever eaten. In the evenings, we sit around the fireplace with our hosts, sip wine and and have a great time. We have been back for a short visit several times with the dogs

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to stay in the heart of San Clemente
Summary: Fantastic!  It was a beautiful place, right in the heart of everything.  The hosts were wonderfully accommodating and took care of every little detail.  The food was great and the place was clean, very comfortable and charming.

Summary Heading: Perfect B&B for a relaxing get away
Summary: If you're looking for a small little B&B for a relaxing weekend down in San Clemente (or the Beach Cities area), look no farther than Always Inn. Craig and Sonia are the newer (since the end of 08' if I remember correctly) property managers and are doing an excellent job of running the place. Unfortunately Sonia was on a personal trip so we did not get to meet her but Craig took great care of us. We stayed in the "Palm Whisper" room which was just big enough for the two of us. Comfortable bed, nice flat screen with a very nice selection of DVDs to watch if there was nothing on TV. They had several patios to relax on and have breakfast on, if you so choose. Craig cooked us an amazing breakfast both mornings and is quite the coffee aficionado (make sure to ask what he's brewing).

What a great place for a romantic getaway. The house sits as a garden oaisis on what would otherwise be a lonely corner. A short walk up the slightly winding brick and stone walkway with gardens to each side leads you to the front door. The first thing that I said when I walked into the rather eclectically furnished front room was "Honey, I'm home". This place gives you a warm comfortable feeling. This tone matches the owners personalities as well, very friendly and down to earth. Our room was a bit on the small side, but there are at least two other rooms available, one larger, and another very large but the semi-private patio and lush gardens more than make up for it. We were treated to a full breakfast on both mornings of our stay. We could have eaten in the dining room, but

This is my second time back this year at The Always Inn B&B, but I have to say this stay was even better than the first. Under the same ownership, Always Inn has a new couple overseeing the property. Craig and Sonia have really poured their hearts into the house. Each room spotless clean inside and out, with a new refreshing and relaxing atomosphere thoughout. Not that I didn't have a nice stay the first time around, especially with breakfast made by the owner herself. Even though this is a smaller house, we never even ran into the other two couples during our entire stay.   I would strongly suggest a stay here if you are looking for a perfect location (one block to downtown shopping with quaint restaurants and a few blocks from the beach), friendly hosts, and a relaxing

Very nice people, but unorganized. We showed up at 3:00pm (check-in time) for our check-in and waited an hour in the "lobby" (living room of their house) for them--no one around. Finally got a call back an hour later, and received directions to the studio apt. (off-site, a mile or so from inn, in a residential neighborhood a ways from main downtown area--not scenic), where the key was under the mat. The studio was just fine and well stocked with everything you need. Not in the most picturesque neighborhood, but it was just fine. No complaints.  The rooms in the "Inn" are just fine, but it's not like any B&B I've ever been to--really feels like someone's house and a little too close quarters for it to be all that comfortable. I'd call it more of a "Room in Someone's House" rather

Stayed at the Always Inn studio that was supposedly located within a "Spanish and Tuscany style resort” and near the beach.  If their idea of a Spanish and Tuscany style resort is a wood lap sided, asphalt shingled roof rental triplex nestled within a major rental district then the local Pizza Hut is authentic Italian food.  The picture on the internet is that of a "resort" that doesn't exist however the room photos are correct.  Again, the photo does not match the actual building.  What is with the Beach Club photos? Summary: Always Inn is in the heart of downtown San Clemente so you can walk to the beach and pier, 60 shops, 16 restaurants, 9 galleries...and I loved the local community theatre literally across the street from the B&B.  My room had all the amenities of a Hyatt without any add on costs for wireless internet, cable, movies and snacks.
